intro: Cheiranthus turritoides, commonly known as the rock wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
